Adjectives

Do you want to practice using adjectives in English?

Adjectives

An adjective is a part of speech that can be used to describe or provide more information about a noun or pronoun that acts as the subject in a sentence. Adjectives are found after the verb or before the noun it modifies.We can use adjectives to describe people, places and things. Examples of some sentences containing adjectives are given below:

We've got a small car.
I saw a white bird.
This book isn't very old.

How to use them

We don't add "s" to the adjective when it's plural. (Underlined Words are adjective words)

My brothers are short.
We've got three black cats.
She watched some old films.

Whenever we describe : Put size adjectives before colour adjectives.

I've got a big, blue ball.
That building is tall and grey.
